original_title: Masterworks of American Avant-garde Experimental Film 1920-1970
overview: Commencing in 1920 with Charles Sheeler and Paul Strand's creative collaboration on Manhatta, successive generations of experimental filmmakers and artists have worked in collaboration or alone to create a cinema capable of expressing dynamic unspoken concepts in totally abstract visual terms.  Flicker Alley and the Blackhawk FilmsÂ® Collection in cooperation with Filmmakers Showcase are proud to present this premiere collection of 37 films created by some of the most acclaimed names of American Avant-garde experimental filmmaking.
title: Masterworks of American Avant-garde Experimental Film 1920-1970
